title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 102.10 - Contiguous census tracts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 102.10 - Contiguous census tracts

State Regulations

The board may designate as an eligible area any city census
tract which is otherwise not eligible if: (a) the tract is contiguous to one or more
eligible census tracts; (b) the
board has received an application for a business facility located in such
tract; and
(c) the tract is not
substantially different in character from its contiguous eligible tract or
tracts in terms of land use, median family income and employment
opportunity. Notes

102.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
